source.bbc3f436:
# This kernel is just test for test_transaction data.

In the train_transaction data, about 0.35% of data are fraud transaction data.

I will make submission result like that : "There is no Fraud transaction"

If 20% of the test data(on the public leaderboard) has same distribution, then its leaderboard score will be about 96.5%.


But, as a result, the leaderboard score shows 50%, it means that there are(test data on the public leaderboard, 20%) has half fraud transactions.

IEEE is not a fool, I was a fool.

But I guess, total test data might has similar ratio of fraud and normal transaction.(But, it is impossible, reason is below...)

It means the test data(on the private leaderboard) has little ratio of fraud data than test data in the public leaderboard.

The Minimum ratio of the fraud rate in total test data is 10% in case of non of test data in the private leaderboard are fraud.

But, minimum 10% is too high. Someone who knows the realworld data, please let me know.

Anyway, in the test data in the private leaderboard might has very low ratio of fraud transaction data.

If I'm wrong, please comment below. Thank you.
